text: Tap at multiple places. This is really nice, has that tropical and rounded fruit IPA character with sort of a crisp dry finish, I suppose from the lagering. Nice combination.

On tap, Ginger Man NYC. Bright golden, thick white foam, nice to see a bright hoppy beer! Clean grainy body, booze hidden well, hint of some rich tea biscuit sweetness, lingering bitterness from hops. Nice strong lager, have to say I didnt get the real aromatics and flavour of the west coast hops as much as some reviewers, but it was a pretty tasty beer.

some hop and some flavor of citrus and other fruit including a bit of tropical. a bit of dryness to cut things short when needed it has good flavor and of course has been done before.nice body not light and sudsy. priced nice.

Hazy yellow with a medium white head. Citrusy aroma, dry. Grapefruit and biscuity malt. Smooth finish, dry

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12-ounce can pours hazy gold with creamy white head. Aroma: pine, pineapple. Flavor: all of the above, plus white pepper. Medium-bodied. Flavor: caramel, brown sugar, bubblegum, dark bread, pepper, pinecones. Rich mouthfeel. Theres a sweetness that assaults your tastes buds and lingers a bit too long for me. Too malt-forward for me, so cloying. Their Excess IPL is a more pleasant beer, but I acknowledge its all personal preference.

Pours a brunt yellow with a white head that leaves lacing. Noseis faint citrus hops. Body is medium light. Taste is malt dominated by citrus hops with lingering bitter aftertaste. 12 oz can in a variety pack More Cans!

A great hoppy IPL with a just the right amount of bitterness and a dry finish. Has a gold color and a frothy white head when poured. The hops permeate the aroma.
Im thankful to be able to buy this on the regular in Massachusetts.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a honey gold color topped by a medium-sized rocky beige head. Aroma is light grainy malt and tropical fruit hops. First sip is light malt and subtle citrus hops. Very smooth with medium body. Bitter hops come in around midtaste. Very drinkable with nice malt/hop balance. At 6.5% ABV, the alcohol only appears late in finish, though it is unobtrusive. Great clinging lace to boot. Outstanding!
Damn thats a good beer! A bright orange color, hazy, with a mild aroma. Strong taste of hops; slight bitterness and some citrus, and a nice clean finish. Its good. Very good. Get it. Thanks!

IPL. If you are a hophead and think lagers are wimpy, then this is a godsend. But I still dont think it works as well as an IPA. The body is too clean to resist the hops, and the result is something that ends bitter (although I myself have a high tolerance for that sort of thing). West Coast grapefruit and pine with a cheesy aftertaste. Not a lot of aroma for its taste. Its pretty good, but Id rather they used ale yeast.

Quality stuff! Pours transparent gold w/ a white head & decent lacing. The aroma is a huge burst of west coast floral hops! The taste is hpppy yet clean & crisp at the same time. Tasty & highly drinkable. If this is a Pilsner, I see why its at the top! Terrific!
On draft at the Jacks Abby Beer Hall it is a clear golden color with an off white head. The aroma is tropical fruit and the taste is strong bitter citrus flavor that has a bitter finish.
On draft at the Jacks Abby Beer Hall. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of citrus and crackers. Crisp, bitter finish.

Pours a lightly hazy rust orange. A citrus hop, light floral, tropical fruit, and pine aroma. Starts with a malt and grain taste with some citrus, hops, pine and fruit. A bitter malt and lingering bitter hop aftertaste.
Pours a golden orange with aroma of grass, tropical fruit, and citrus.Grassy flavor with tropical fruit,and citrus. Very nice.
Yellow-orange, medium head, fruity aroma, a bit hoppy, lemony, bitter flavor, hoppy, lemony, fun, medium bodied.

Bottle. Bready malt aroma with notes of grass, citrus and a bit of tropical fruit hops. Pours clear golden-amber colored with a thin but retentive white head that also has good lacing. Starts with bready malt flavor as well as a bit of grassy hops. Finishes dry with grapefruity citrus and tropical fruit hop flavors with just a hint of piney hop bitterness. Pretty good IPL.
on tap at City Tap House University City - sweet hoppy aroma and flavor. Nice golden amber color. Good flavor.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Clear deep golden with a small, white head. Nose is extremely fruity, slightly citrusy. Rich, malty body, again fruity with a potent late bitterness. Very well rounded, extremely smooth. 280916

Hazy dark golden pour with minimal white head. Aroma is dank and fruity of the tropical variety, still allowing some bready malt through. Flavor is the same with a good punch of tropical fruits dominating a malty backbone. Finish is smoother than expected. Smooth sipping throughout. Very well done.

12oz bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small off-white head. Floral, citrusy hop aroma. Initial caramel maltiness turns into grapefruit with notes of mango, grass, bread, light pine, and a growing bitterness. Lingering bitter, hoppy grapefruit finish. Medium bodied, slightly above average carbonation, and a full mouthfeel.

Can at a toddlers birthday party. Great IPL that showcases both sides of the style really well. The lager component is really clean and subtle, with just a bit of clean malt flavor, and the hops are prominent without being out of balance. Great on a hot day.

On tap at BGH. Hoppy on the nose. Really well balanced and hoppy. Light but strong. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle served in a chalice glass. Enjoyed at PiBar-Lausanne. Pours a cloudy orange color forming a small and creamy white head with medium retention and some lacings left in the glass. Nose is sweet, very malty and very herby. Pine and booze. Taste follows the nose. Very sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of caramel and biscuit. Strong notes of tropical fruits, resin and pale malts. Hints of pine. Full body. Medium carbonation. Caramel, resin and pine in the aftertaste. Not very persistent. Good drinkability. Great strong Lager.

A unique spin. Nice maltfeel with a touch of graham cracker. Hops are rich, but not overpowering. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sweet honey notes come through on the nose. The beer is a straw pale with very little head. The taste is mild, but balanced, with honey, bread and a light herbal grit at the finish. Goes down smooth and clean.

A pillowy well laced head on a golden straw body. A massive citrus and tropical fruit nose is a hit. The hops are there in force in the taste profile - grapefruit, kiwi, orange and melon are all fresh and refreshing. A very drinkable bitterness that is not astringent or difficult to take. A solid medium body and carbonation, and the lager yeast, help give it a smooth, enjoyable mouth feel. The malt is appropriately sweet but understated.
Draft - Nice fresh leafy hops. Clear gold with a rich white head. Nice leafy fresh hoppy notes and a clean bitter finish. Solid.

On tap at As Is NYC on 7th July 2016. Cloudy amber with thick creamy head soon becoming shallow but affording full lacing. Rich hoppy aroma with pungency and tanginess. Powerful grassy, citric liquid pass, whilst the finish is slightly nutty, with tangerine and grapefruit but short-lived. Full-bodied with a zingy mouthfeel.
Can at Beer Culture. Mostly clear orange with spotty lacing. Citrus and citrus rind. Some maltiness comes through and provides a strong backbone. Mid dry close.

I am not digging the hop character in this one. It is an onion bomb. Its nice looking though, cloudy orange w/ a long lasting head. Aside from onion, I get some woody pine notes and some borderline harsh earthy bitterness in the finish. There is a very slight touch of simple sweet malt in the background but this is very much a hop centered brew. Its medium to full bodied, just a hair on the heavy side, w/ fairly vigorous carbonation. Aside from this tastes like onions, its pretty well made, I guess.

Tropical hop aroma along with some floral malt scents in the backdrop. Nice lovely golden color with almost no head. A lovely bouquet floral like malt taste. Nice juicy hop flavor coming out from the middle to the end. Nice smooth finish with a bit of a bite. Medium body what a delectable Crisp carbonation. My favorite IPL for sure. Nice brew!
Bottled 33cl. Color : cloudy yellow with low white head. Nose : mainly citrus. Aromas : citrus, malt and sour ale. Medium bitterness, low texture and carbonation.

Draft at Federal Taphouse, Harrisburg PA.
Head is initially average sized, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting.
Body is medium to dark yellow.
Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (resin, grapefruit, kumquat).
Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately to heavily bitter.
Medium to full body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.
Not much in the nose other than the strong raw hops, but its not unpleasant. Good flavor balance and mouthfeel, though, and the head lasts well so its mostly enjoyable overall.
Pours a deep golden color with a large foamy head. Notes of lemon, honey, orange citrus, dry grains, and sweet bread.

Golden orange color with nice head and lacing. The aromas and flavors have lots of grapefruit and orange zest back up with some grassiness, a touch of sweetness and a persistent but pleasant level of bitterness. Finishes dry and slightly bitter to invite another sip.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2016 Can into a snifter showing moderately filtered honey amber with a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of pine and cannabis. 

The palate is light bodied and well carbonated. Flavors of clean pineapple and citrus with good notes of citrus on the mid-palate. Clean lager malts show lightly throughout to balance out the beer. Very light tea-like bitterness despite the high hopping. Great IPL.

Golden orange in color... Aroma of citrus hops, some tropical fruits... Flavor is light and crisp, yet dry and light bodied... Lots of citrus hops, tropical fruit notes... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ As Is NYC. Hazy dark orange with foamy off-white head, floral hops aroma, medium carbonation, lightly bitter orange peel taste, very smooth, medium bitter finish. It feels like a smoother IPA.

Can to mason to catch the smell, pours a golden amber with foamy white diminishing head, minimal lacing, some citrus and tropical smell, grapefruit, melon, more of a citrus finish, medium body, biscuit, a bit of lemon, lighter crisp finish, well balanced, 2 thumbs up excellent

UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 Got in a BIF from tasterschoice62. 12 ounce can into lager glass, canned on 1/22/2016. Pours lightly hazy golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, mango, melon, lemon zest, orange peel, light pepper, pine, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, mango, melon, lemon zest, orange peel, light pepper, pine, cracker, biscuit, light honey, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/citrus rind/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, mango, lemon/orange peel, pepper, pine, cracker, biscuit, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero astringent hop flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from bitterness that increases through the glass. Very clean on lager flavors with zero yeast ester notes present. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately sticky/creamy/bready, and lightly resinous balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent IPL style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Harmoniously combining bottom-fermenting yeast lager with hops famous West Coast being halfway between a traditional India Pale Ale and Pilsner lager-fermented and aged prolonged cold. Light golden-amber color with a head of white foam immaculate medium-sized soft and fleecy. The taste is exactly what it advertises the aroma: resinous hops fruit, citrus and tropical mango, grapefruit and lychee plus some earthy notes, toast, cake with nuts and grass. When dry finish him a nice profile is accentuated bitter. Very clean

Bottle enjoyed at home
Copper hazy, creamy white head. Smell of grapefruit, piny resins, floral hops, quite complex and inviting. Medium to heavy sweet, american malt profile, hop fruityness, pine resins, wood, grapefruit. Heavy bitter, resin tail. Very nice. The hops really play the main role in here
Bottle. Slightly cloudy light orange. Nose of orange and tropical fruit hops. Taste is biscuit malts, and some indistinct slightly bitter hops. Clean and refreshing.

Light orange-brown, small tan head. Aroma herbal hops, malt. Medium body. Grainy and grassy hop flavors, really not that hoppy though tending toward the malty off dry side. Dry more than bitter. Found this to be ok, not really that flavorful. Got it on draft at a less than stellar establishment so its possible it wasnt that fresh, open to retrying it elsewhere.
355ml bottle at home, from AleselA, Paisley, powdery corn, citrus aroma, golden, amber with a very thin, bubbly head, yeasty, corn, vegetable, hoppy, oily with a prolonged modern hop aftertaste.

33cl bottle
cloudy orange color with white creamy head
hoppy aroma with hint of citrus

12 oz bottle shared with ebone1988 from Dumpster Day Box No. 1. The pour is a nice ruby tinted golden yellow with a nice pillowy white head and a couple spots of lace as it falls to a bubbly collar. The aroma is strange. It smells like the fermentation of beer outside of Founders. It's a sweet potato malt that really comes through. It's not bright and hoppy, nor does it carry the metallic lager tendency. The flavor is not hoppy at all. There is a strong malt presence that comes through in a dominating fashion. The sweet potato malts are hugely present and there is a touch of bitterness on the finish. The mouth feel is heavy and syrupy for what it should be. There is minimal carbonation present. This thing just hangs when it should be bright and sharp. The aftertaste carries the heavy malt fermentation and just meh. Damn you Jack's Abby!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20, out of "Dumpster Day" box #1. Aroma is like...bran cereal. Dry. It smells like outside a brewery when theyre brewing beer, that exact smell. Then some pine but mostly "outside of Founders" smell. Appearance is amber golden, off white head. Tastes much as it smells, a ton of malt, a lot of brewery aroma flavor, not remotely hoppy, otherwise very light. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, slight pine in the aftertaste. Overall, this is about what I expected, not great.

On tap at West End Grill, Randolph MA. Citrus, strawberry and caramel aroma. Slightly hazy copper under a lasting, thin, white sheet. Excellent balance of resinous citrus and pine hops with sweet, slightly dried fruity caramel and a dry finish. Moderate to medium bitterness. Medium body, medium carbonation, crisp, despite being a largish drink.

Bottle pour into pint glass. Aroma is strong citrus hops with some herbs and mild resin and cheese, bread. Appearance is mildly hazy golden orange with lots of sparkle, 1/2 finger-width foamy head and sticky lacing. Taste is citrusy hops with mild bitterness balance with sweet. Palate is medium bodied with soft texture, lively carbonation and long citrusy mild bitter finish. Overall, this is as advertised--cross between lager and IPA. These guys really know how to do things with lagers. Great at getting the flavor out of the hops without turning it into a bitter pill. Good stuff.
Clear amber, thick white froth. Fruity hop aroma, peach and grapefruit, some caramel. Similar flavour, sweetish with alcholic bitterness. Ends on an alcoholic orange juice note. Not impressed.
It pours murky orange with medium creamy head. Aroma is citrus and hops. Extremely hoppy too for a Pils, very tasty, fruity and refreshing, light body, dry finish. Lovely.

Bottle from trade. Poured into snifter. Light sulfury lager yeast character in the nose with moderate to strong citrus hops, moderate grapefruit with some marmalade and jam. Very clear, pale yellow with a small white head. Taste is a weird, mineral like almost reminiscent of a dortmunder type lager. Moderate hop character but nowhere near IPA level, maybe due to lagering. Overall a very nice beer but the hops seem a tad faded and the water is very mineral like.
Poured a golden color with a white head. Aroma of pale grain stale fruity hops. Flavor similar, a bit cleaner than the aroma, but no real enticements.
330ml bottle from Valhallas Goat. Hazy orange amber, good head. Creamy corn hop aroma. Boiled sweet & hop flavour. Sharp with bitter sweet aftertaste. More like an IPA than a lager.
It was great and tasty in a really malty way. Creamy foam and smooth in taste. Easy to drink too much. Tasted from tap.
Citrus hops aroma. Pours a clear golden color. Slight white head. Quite bitter and citrus taste. Light slightly fizzy carbonation; goes down easy. Very good beer.

This was poured into a pilsener glass.
The appearance was a slightly bronzed orange color with a one and a half foamy white head. After it dissipated, clingy and messy lacing stuck in a slight bubbly yet some light rings do end up showing their appearance.
The smell started off with a sweet grassy and light spiced (black pepper) rolling into a slight breadiness.
The taste reminisced the aroma sweetly adding the spice to balance. Theres a slight sweet grassy to semi-spiced aftertaste running into the finish slyly.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a nice sessionability about it. Carbonation hits very low yet eloquently allows a light dryness hitting my tongue.
Overall, for the most part, this is a really nice India Pale lager that I would have again

On tap at Hops and Pie poured a clear golden amber with a small lasting amber head. Aromas of bread, grapefruit and a hint of earthiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of bread, grapefruit and light pine with a crisp dry lingering bitter finish.

Vet slightly hazy deep golden with a thin sticky rocky white head. Lovely floral resiny aroma with some bright herbal and piney tones and a subtle grapefruity sweetness. Full flavor that starts just slightly German-crackery maltiness, some peppery bitterness, lovely piney and slightly grapefruit-rind-y hop flavor and bitterness. Crisp and bitter and lagery yet dank and with loads of complex hop flavors.

Wicked hoppy and delicious! Pretty aroma with interesting citrus and spice. Pour is nice as well, caught a little bit of sediment towards the end, so it finishes with a beautiful golden haze and clean thin white head. Beer really shines in the flavor and mouthfeel. Rich, but clean, hoppy but smooth. Top notch IPL.

Bottle:
Pours clear, medium gold, with a small white head.
Fruity, lagery, citrus aroma.
Taste is sweet...orange, mango, grapefruit...
Piney/Grapefruit-peel hopping.
Delicious.....a great beer.

A 12 fl oz bottle with a manufacturing date of 1st December 2014 and poured into a pint glass (although Id consider using an IPA glass for this next time). The beer poured a slightly hazy golden orange colour with a less than one finger white head that leaves some spotty lacing. Aromas are mainly citrus zest hops followed by some tropical mango and light pepperiness. Light caramel malt flavours followed by some nice bitter citrus and grassy hops orange and piney finish. Crisp and dry, light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Overall, I am impressed. The world needs more lagers like this. It is far and away the best lager Ive tried, and a very good example of what can and should be done with lagers.

The Tap, Boston tap: pours orange with a white head. Aroma is a beautiful bouqet of fruity and floral hops. Taste is very juicy hops with a noce alightly bitter finish. Wap more about fruity expression than about bitterness and britality. Nice.

Pours golden with copper hues with a small off-white head, fading into a good lace. Nice earthy hops aromas with some citrus and a definite lager nose. Clean, crisp attack, smooth creamy body, good bitterness that lingers for a good while. This world needs more great lager like this one!

(Bottle, 0.355 l - MFG 10.02.2015, at Stadin Panimobaari, 20150821) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, grass and mild sweetness. Flavours were fruitiness, grass, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was grassy and bitter. A well drinkable hoppy brew.

Bottle 0.355l at Stadin Panimobaari, Helsinki. Manufactured 10/02/2015. Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, some pine, grain, hints of hops and malts. Quite harsh.
Bitter hops, then a punch of grapefruit and malt. Not too sweet, but some fruit in there, then leads to a fairly dry finish with a very nice balanced hops profile. Quite good.

Great discovery. 

Light IPA-like beer (was presented to me as part of a IPA degustation). Very well-balanced with exceptional aromas.

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy orange-apricot color with a large creamy-soapy orange-white head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was sweet, tnagy pine, honey and citrus. The flavor was sweetyet bitter, piney, citric and a hint of perfume. Long finish with growing bitterness. Moderately full bodied. Tasty!

Im rating this one as an IPA. Pours a slightly hazy amber from a bottle with a small white head. Aroma of floral/tropical hops, flavor is not quite citrusy, but sweet and not overly bitter surprisingly. Very good beer. HELEN
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with a big frothy off white head, fresh citrus aroma with a hint of pine, taste has clean malts along, pine resin, citrus, some biscuit action, good.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are straw, flowers, citrus, and caramel - with a slightly dry finish.
Tap Pony James. Translucent dark gold. Nice fresh hop character, wet and leafy. Low bitter. Medium or heavy mouthfeel for lager. Nice.

Pours hazy golden with thin white head. Nose is slightly skunky hop. Aromas are tropical fruits, caramel, grass, some citrus. Low carbonation, medium body. Medium bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355ml bottle. Pours dark orange with a large head. Aroma is mango, pine and caramel. Taste has passionfruit to start and a crisp mango finish.

This is so good, I dont know what else to say. This is a blast of dankness, citrus and pine. Absolute hop bomb of a beer. The taste follows suit. Absolutely wrecks your shit hoppy with a super smooth finish from the lager yeast. I love these ipls, theyre so refreshing in this huge sea of sameness lately. Ill drink this over most ipas currently, its that good. Cheers.
Bottle. Aroma of resin, tropical and citrus fruits. Citrus and tropical flavours with a crisp bitter and somewhat boozy finish. I wish all lagers were this well-hopped ;)

Pours darker gold with a medium white head. Aroma is citrus, resin, caramel and hint of toast. Taste is moderate bitters and a touch of sweetness, mostly bitter. Medium bodied with a crisp drying finish. Good carbonation.
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear gold pour with a thick white head. Aroma of malt, grapefruit, cucumber and pine. Malty and sweet flavor with some pine accents before a grassy hop finish.

From 12oz bottle, from variety pack, poured into tulip glass

Aroma: Citrus, cascade, American "c" hops

Appearance: Golden/copper, hazy, off white/tan head

Taste: Medium bitter

Palate: light to medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation, bitter finish

Overall: Cant believe I havent rated this. Ive had a lot of this and think its a great American IPA-like lager. I remember enjoying this more in my previous sessions than this bottle. A very nice American hop profile with a solid malt backbone. Very easy to drink and not harsh or too bitter. Nice dry and clean finish, but feels like its lacking something. Aroma is quick to fade. A very solid beer and better than most American IPAs on the market.

355 ml bottle bought at The Bottle Shop in Sai Kung.
Looks: Translucent amber honey colour; One-quarter finger head and soapy white foam which fades in 40 seconds; Excellent sticky lacing with very slight carbonation. 

Aroma: Fragrant malt, with strong floral, passion fruits, oranges, very light grapefruit, molasses, pine, light resin, spices, light crackers, strong lemon and fresh grass.

Taste: Close to medium sweet malt, with strong lemon peels, grapefruits, strong molasses, earth, light pine, strong resin, strong biscuits, strong lime, strong bitter hops and fresh grass.

Body: Mid to light. Slick, thick and oozy palate. 

Mouth Feel: Pretty rich maltyness, quite thick and slick. The rich hops make it almost Ale-like. The strong citrusy and oozy taste suggest 3Cs, though the grapefruits and pine is rather low, mostly lime, earth, fair resin and spices. Expressive but not out of control. Neat! 

Hoppiness: Passion fruits, oranges, very light grapefruit, floral, light pine, resin in nose. Strong lime, lemon peels, light citrus, ooze, light pine and earth in taste. Bitterness is notably strong but short-lived, for an abrupt, moderate to strong bitter-sweet finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Very limey and quite bitter to mouth.

Comments: The 3Cs or whatever West Coast hops being put into this IPL give me a feeling of its hands being tied - its citrusy and resiny aroma and taste are notablely neat, but perhaps a bit too restrained to be fully impressive. Very nice to have one no doubt, but for now this is above average but not great.

Bottle from Ammersine magazine Wien 5. Orange color with medium white head. Caramel malt, citrus hops, fruits, resin in aroma. Solid malty base with caramel followed by nice citrus hoppy kick with tangerines, oranges, pines. Long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks ArizviSG. Hazy gold with a white ring. A little orange and a little onion aroma, sweet juicy taste and then bitter and a little dry. Soft fizz, fruity finish.
Bottle shared at a tasting at Maxs place. Hazy golden. Nice fruity hops aroma, tropical and citric. Dry flavor of fruity hops and pleasant bitterness. Medium-bodied. Good.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2016 Bread, orange and sage. Citrus to bitter to a clean finish.  Well balanced. Third time around with this beer.  I drank it a warmer temperature and scored it higher this time.  Its very good good but not in the same league as Mass Rising.

355ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. MFG 02/10/2015.


Golden colour with a small white head. Hoppy, fruity, crisp. Nice one.

Esta casa presume de realizar lagers... con levaduras lager.. y con ingredientes típicos de ales americanas... En este caso pretenden una IPA LAGER. Lo logran? Definivamente sí. Anaranjada con un dedo de espuma que dura un minuto. Potente aroma lupulado, muy frutal: mango, melocoton, naranja.. En boca, textura agradable y mantiene el aroma, acabando en un final a la vez muy frutal y muy seco, por supuesto amargo. Genial.

Pours clear amber liw white head
Aromas of tropical fruits, pine, lager like bready tones
Taste has caramel, resin, pine, tropical fruits
Pours clear amber with a low white head. Aromas of apricot, peach, rye bread, pine. Taste is apricot, peach, grapefruit, rye bread. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Caramel color, tight, full, creamy head, good carbonation, and absolutely wonderful citrus hoppy aroma. Smooth, not overpowering taste.

A hazy, golden beer, a head is blond and small. Aroma has lemon and other citrusfruits, some grain, fresh. Taste has citrusfruits, some other fruits, medium bitterness is slightly harsh. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Interesting and strongly citrusfruity.
Draft. Cloudy orange body, looks like a work of art. Aroma is a sweet citrus note of fresh air. Flavor has a sweet citrus note with a malty finish. Very interesting.
Very good, this lager is hoped like an ale. Nice robust hop flavor. Great lacing as it goes down. Will get again.
Bonus from a recent trade. Nice caramel malt smooth body. Light and faint hops some grassy some herbal. Would like a little more here please.
From tap at Ølbaren. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, citrus, malt and caramel.

Bottles and draft since debut, Boston areaOf the three main beers that came out initially (this, Red Tape and Smoke and Dagger), I like this one by far the least. The beer pours fine, well-carbonated, golden and bright with strong head retention. From the first sniff and sip, its clear that this beer is marketed to the aggressively bittered IPA crowd. Heavy, heavy, heavy, heavy resin. Just tastes like a mouthfull of acid. Can barely choke down a pint of it at the bar when there isnt much else. Thankfully, Jabby Brau is showing up most places as well.
Bottle. Golden yellow pour with a medium off white head. Aroma of graham crackers, citrus and pine hops. Easy drinking with a crisp clean finish.

Bottle @ Getränkefeinkost in Berlin


Appearance: Darker gold body, white head with some retention

Aroma: Pine, citrus, floral

Taste: Pine resin, grapefruit, tropical fruit, caramel

Palate: Medium body, crisp dry finish
Pours hazy peach with low white head. Aroma of pine, resin, grapefruit. Taste is sweet, resinous and malty caramel. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2015 Beer 400! Big citrus pine nose. Big! Super foam from the first batch of Jack?s Abby to hit PA. Golden. Mild bitter, wheaty finish. Citrus zest, pine, lemon.

50cl Bottle from Vonk Zaandam. Slightly hazy orange colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, caramel, vanilla biscuits, some resin. Flavour is medium sweet, malty, caramel, cookies, tropical fruits, citrus, decent hoppy bitter finish. Medium bodied. Would never have guessed this is a lager.
Floral and light resin hop aroma. Cloudy orange color with a medium white head. Medium bitter beginning that increases in the middle fades in the finish and builds in the end again.
I like this beer a lot as a standard go to. Great hoppy smell and flavor. Nice Amber color, and good aftertaste.

12 oz bottle. Misty yellow orange with a clingy white head. Nose is orange, pineapple, mango and green apple with a hint of spearmint. Soft and silky with tiny carb prickles. Quenching yet substantial. Taste is bitter lemon, slightly sweet apple and marjoram with an earthy finish. Impressive lager.

Bright orange and clear pour from 12oz bottle at home, obtained in a trade. White ring of foamy head. Apricot and citrus fruity aroma. Lighter taste and body. Tropical fruit, lemon, a dry and slightly bitter finish. Really exceeded expectations.
Bottle from SJ. Nice bold notes of citrus, pepper, mango , bread and hops. A solid blend. I enjoyed it.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2015 Dark golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, pine, citrus, toast, and grapefruit. Taste of much of the same, bitter, lightly dry finish.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 Draft at Moriartys. Hazy rusty orange pour with a soapy top that left lots of lace. Earthy tropical citrus hop resins. Bruised orange peels. Rosin. Tree sap. Incense. Mango. Moderately sweet medium caramel malts. Dry resiny finish. Distinctive.
Very crisp and citrus. Refreshing and balanced hops. Nice fruit and floral aroma. Tap.
Pours a clear gold color with some lacing and no head retention. Tastes hoppy and citrusy, but does remind me of lager. A decidedly nice drink.
Poured from bottle hazy golden color with one finger white head. Aromas of citrus hops and pine. Taste is crisp and fresh with citrusy notes and a balanced hop finish.

Bottle from Capones. Pours hazy gold with 1-finger, white head. Nose was resiny hops, pine, mango, black pepper, tangerine. Tastes resiny. fruity, hoppy, with notes of malt, apricot, tangerine, mango. Complex flavor and finish. Delicious.

Bottle. Pale goldenyellow in color with a whitish head. Citrus, floral summer meadow and grainy notes on the nose. Fresh grassy notes too. Crisp and refreshing. Lemony juicyness and bit of grainy notes backing up the package here tastewise. Excellent brew, and something that would suite very well during the summer time.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2017 Pours pale amber with a foamy, off-white head that dissipates within a minute or so. Moderate lacing. Nose is mildly malty, notes of mango and lemon. Taste is somewhat sweet with a cross-current of hoppy bite. Medium body, lively carbonation. Very tasty, refreshing brew. Glad to see some rethinking of the tired, old lager!
Copper with an off-white head. Aroma of pine and citrus. Smooth palate. Nice toasted malt background. Well made.

Nice IPA scent but not overpowering, rich golden color, has a ipa taste to start but has a fruit hint so it's not bitter. They say it's aged, maybe that mellows it out some, no noticeable aftertaste, clean taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Yummy! Poured from bottle into craft pint. Golden orange with two fingers of off white head with good retention and lacing. Aroma is pine resin, grapefruit. Taste is fruity and citrusy, finishes pretty dry.

12 ounce bottle from Whole Foods Dedham. Hazy orange, thin creamy off-white head. Good retention. Aroma of piney, resiny, citrus, tropical hops, pale malt. The taste is tropical, piney, citrus hops, caramel malt. Medium bodied, strong lingering bitterness, decent balance. Solid.
Really good taste. Nice body. Not sure if I would call it an Imp. Pilsener, but is that even a style or not one could debate. Great beer!

One of a large number of samples I had at the Extreme Beer Fest in Boston 3/21/32014. Huge hop bitterness aroma and flavor, malt? maybe. Earlier Rating: 6/21/2013 Total Score: 4.1Pours a slightly hazy medium golden color with a huge long lasting fluffy white head. Spicy earthy bready citrus aromas mix wonderfully within my nostrils. The flavor provides a bit more hop bite than the aroma suggested. Spicy earthy and citrus provide a nice backdrop for the light bready malt that comes in the flavor. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a sweet spicy mouthfeel. Huge hoppiness for a lager and damn it really works for me. Great spicy hoppy beer, I wish they would distribute to NH!
A difficult style it is, but this one comes close to truly delivering. Better body than usual lets the hops come to their right. Nice and crisp too.
Bottle. Orange malt and pine/grapefruit peel aroma. Golden yellow with moderate head. Sweet orange malt and moderately bitter grapefruit peel flavor. Nice body. Very tasty.

12 oz bottle from Premier Gourmet. Pours a lightly cloudy golden orange colour with modest-sized white head. Aroma has big tropical fruit and citrusy hop notes with some spicy resin and a bit of caramel. Flavour has grapefruit, mango, lychee and pineapple with some resinous notes and a solid sweet maltiness. Finishes a little dry. Impressive.

12 oz bottle poured into a Jacks Abby snifter. Bottled 3/2/2015. Clear golden orange with a finger of off-white head. Aromas of grapefruit citrus fruit and peel, floral notes, hop oils, tropical fruit. Tastes of grapefruit citrus, floral hops, pine. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Medium carbonation, juicy mouthfeel. Great IPL.

Bottle poured into a shaker. Pours dark orange with a half finger off white head. Aroma is gugely hoppy. Dank, topical and citrus fruits dominate with a hint of pine. Taste is medium bitter, follows aroma. Super long finish. Great brew!

0.355 l bottle, thanks hanniku! Deep golden color. Very floral and tropical aroma with orange, pineapple, pine and lemon. Smooth bitter and tropical taste, fresh hop character. Really good smooth taste with excellent drinkabilty.

Oh yeah, that one was special. It was so hoppish and mild and drinkable and nice. A nice balanced piwo with a big body containing some fruits, some hay, a bit bread and a big alcohol towards the end. Good looking, good tasting = thumbs up.

Bottle from BenH - thank you! The beer has got a light hazy golden colour with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of intense hops, citrus fruits and spruce. Taste of hops, pineapple, mandarinas, citrus fruits, mild herbs, spruce, mild spices and white bread. Mild bitter finish. Very quaffable and damn good to drink. Loved it.

from Au Trappiste - murky orange beer with a long lasting foam; light grainy and mainly fruity aroma (mango, peaches); full-bodied, light chewy with a subtle carbonation; dry and solidly bitter, fruity and gently corny finish; some sweetness below
Bottle at the Sir Garnet, Norwich. Poured a slightly hazy orange colour with a small white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, and tropical fruit. Quite high in carbonation. Dry bitterness to finish.
Bottle at home from ales by mailhazy bright amber with fluffy beige head. Rich dank Hempy hops. Mango pith, full bodied sweet sticky mango, light, fruity, far too easy drinking.

The first Ive had of this style. Very nice hop aroma with more of a cereal than caramel maltiness. Taste was of citrus pine hops and very clean bready melon malt. Finish was not as dry as expected. Nice. I would really enjoy this in summer.

22/XI/14 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from a trade @ Hannahs place - BB: n/a, bottled: 21/V/14 (2014-1399) Thanks to teorn88 for the trade!
Clear orange beer, creamy irregular big yellowish head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet, caramel malts, some citrus and pineapple, some honey, little oxidized, some mango, lychees. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter, citrus, fruity start, caramel malts, pineapple, lychee, soft hop flavour. Aftertaste: sweet malty backbone, some citrus, bit of honey.

Bottle: Very light copper-amber color with excellent clarity. Only a very mild haze in the center thats gone after a few minutes. Foamy white head leaves modestly chunky lacing behind. Nose is heavily hopped, giving off notes of lemon zest, pineapple, bitter citrus rind, leafy pines, hop oils, & only a mild touch of toasted cracker malts backing up the hop assault. First sip is lathered with wet, juicy, oily, piney hops. Somewhat grassy, almost floral, & most definitely pungent. On the edge of dank, but not quite there. Light resinous attack, too. The latter half reveals a larger fruit essence of pineapple, grapefruit, & herbal lemon tea leaves. Modest essence of crackery & bread laden malts, however the bitterness of the hops sustains much further into the finish than the malts, leaving a mild white pepper spiciness on the tongue after each sip. Fresh, clean, snappy mouth feel. Crushable as hell. Delicious stuff.

Pale golden-orange pour the aroma is bright and spicy. A nice tropical hop aroma along with a bit of soft sweetness the hops are a bit faded on the palate but its still a lovely brew. Has a honeyed sort of flavour on the back.

50cl bottle from Euston Tap, London. It pours a golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is fresh hops, citrus peel, grainy malts. Taste is again medium hoppy loghtly bitter medium sweet, with grains, bread, grapefruit, pine needles and citrus. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Overall, better than peers

Draft, legal C
APPEARANCE – 
Light yellow for an ipa. NOSE - 
Some hop character, nothing really stands out. FLAVOR - light hoppiness. Not overwhelmingly bitter, floral or resinous. NOTES - pretty typical ipa. Unremarkable, but it seems like it could be a good session drinker. Supports Shigadeyo's theory that 80% of IPAs are the same.
Clear gold pour. Aroma is citrus, lemon and orange. Taste is citrus, pine, and bitter orange. Juicy hop start that lingers into a dry resin finish . Notes of grapefruit finish it off. Very good.

Tap. Shakespeares, Sheffield. Hazy gold. Thin, dense, lasting, white head. Fresh, minty, black berry hop. Its akin to a lager with a blackcurrant top. In the nicest possible way. Taste is gentle bitter. Some fruity sweet. Crisp, clean palate. Finishes juicy bitter. Some dry on the close. Quite unusual, really, but very drinkable, fresh, and tasty. Nice one.

Cask at GBBF 2012. Poured a hazy, pale golden colour, with a halo of white head. Aroma of pils yeast, grain and floral hops. Citrus hop flavours, with crisp grassy notes and some bready malt. Finish was dry straw, resin and grapefruit.
Aromas of fresh pine, sharp citrus. Slightly hazy orange-gold, mostly fading white head. Dry, very fresh hop flavors. Light bodied, very clean.
Aromas of fresh hops and some dry citrus. White foamy head and lighter golden body. Fresh crisp hop flavors and notes of lemon. Dry and crisp on the palate.

Bottle @ home at weekly tasting. Clear golden orange colour with a small to medium sized white head. Smells hops, malts, fresh, nice. Tastes slightly hoppy, malts, sweet, fresh. Hoppy pilsener. Medium body, soft carbo.

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Slightly hazy, dark yellow, medium white head. Nice hoppy ale, with notes of citrus, melons, tropical fruit, caramel. Light body. Medium to high carbonation. Really refreshing.
Yellowish mildly cloudy,yellowish foam that dosnt really last. Apricot and flower in the aroma. Mild toffé with strong fruity bitterness in the aftertaste.
Hazy piss golden, stringy ringed head. Decent mango stir, light pine. Foamy carbonation. Cackle of hops, light bitter and cooling malt linger. Bottle, ScoIrl tasting
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma of grapefruit, pine resin. Similar taste, lots of grapefruit. Decent body, bitter.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours pale amber, nose is pineapple, citrus, taste is juicy pineapple, bitter, dry.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear pale gold with a thin white head. Aromas of citrus, pine. Taste is light bitter. Finishes smooth, light bitter. Nice.
bottle at home ... golden amber .. small white head ... soft light smokey toffee malt nose ... grassy hay ... soft oily fruits ... grassy finish... not me

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy golden amber with a white head. Aroma of fruity citrus hops, yeast, pine, grassy. Taste is bitter sweet hoppy, bit bready yeasty, malts. Long hoppy bitter aftertaste. Very nice, love the aroma.
12oz bottle pours a pale yellow color with a bit of head. Great balance of hops and malt. Better than most IPAs I've had lately.

Bottle, Chester Beer & Wine. Clear dark orange pour with a small white head. Caramel and fruity, piney hop in the beak. Really welcome hoppage in the flavour alongside some juicy citrus leading to a dry bitter finish. A crisp and characterful lager that is a really good interpretation of the style.
Bottle. Nice flavor, definite hop presence crisp, citrus notes. I like the IPL twist. I think the lager lets the hops play a bit. Enjoyable
UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 Bottle from Trader Joes in Cambridge. Aroma is light malt, herbal, distant fruit. Super clean flavors, resinous hops, pine, grass. Abrupt, clean finish. Great lager.

Bottle @ Studenterhuset, Århus. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is malt, light bready, grass, fruit, apples, light citrus. Flavor is malt, flowers, grass, nice bitter citrusnotes, grapefruit. Medium body, lively carbonation, lasting bitter finish. 251014

Bottle. 12 oz. Courtesy of the Dad. Pours raw honey golden with a fat, fluffy white head. Aroma is apple skin, pear skin, honey, and champagne yeast. Taste is astringent, clean hop resin with a bit of apple sweetness in the finish. Light and clean on the tongue. Very good.

A clear copper color with a nice white head. A slight presence of carbonation. Aroma was of mild toasted malts and a light sense of sweetness. Hops were a mix of floral and citrus. Flavor was
Mildly sweet initially. Floral hops came through and the citrus hops were mostly in the finish. Easy to drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Brewtopia. Golden honey color with dense lasting head and full lace. Medium delicate lemony grassy pastry aroma. Dry tropical fruity sweetness with assertive citrus rind and herbal bitter dry finish. Light and lively. Hard to believe its a lager. Hard to put down. Excellent.

Bottle as an extra in trade. Thanks! Pours hazy golden colored with a one finger white head. Aroma is grassy hops, tropical fruit, lager yeast sweet aromas. Flavor is sweet tropical fruits, pineapples, grapefruits, mango, some honey sweetness, lightly crisp grassy pine, but not particularly bitter. Smooth body, medium plus heaviness especially for the style, with medium plus carbonation. Crisp finish and easy drinking. Very nice.

Bottled from Coppers Newcastle. Hazy orange pour, with a chalky and caramel aroma. The caramel dominates the tongue, making it cloying. It tastes unbalanced and a little rough. Sweet alcoholic finish.

From Bottle Shop. Pours an almost-clear bright light orange with watery white head. Smells of dry bitter piney hop, wet crisp malt, bit of cinnamon pepper spice. Tastes (as advertised) like a hoppy lager - quite bitter but crisp. Taste doesnt last long. Body is thin in a way that complements a lager - the spiciness also prevents it from feeling thin. Good and is nicely very bitter though the taste is a little boring (almost seems a waste of hop). Solid beer though.

Bottle from Bottle Shop at home. Translucent light amber. Minimal head. Aroma is very yeasty with strong grassy hops. Taste is bready like a sourdough with very strong hops for a lighter lager - bitter and grassy with pine. Crisp finish which is really nice. Very balanced. Only flaw would be the slightly one note hops flavor. Much better than the Sam Adams Double Agent IPL which is also good but not as hoppy. Would definitely get again.

Bottle from Euston Tap. Pours a nice rich gold with medium carbonation. Lovely rich heavy hop aroma. Flavour is less hoppy, more lagery notes - which I dont particularly care for but Im sure this is a grand example of a hoppy lager style. Great for the aroma and no doubt a well made beer but I probably wouldnt have another (unless it was on draught, at source, and cheaper!).
Super citrus hop aroma blast with just as bitter start on the tongue to match. Mellow yellow amber color with a thin head. Very enjoyable.

Bottled. Pours a brilliant hazy orange color. Aroma is big orange, citrus, hop forward , slight maltiness in the back. Flavor is orange and hops up front, with a fair amount of maltiness, sweetness and breadiness. Mouthfeel is big carbonation. Very noticeable carbonation here. Not as good as their Hopstitution XL but its no slouch.
Clear amber color, moderate head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, light caramel, toast, bread. Medium to light bodied, very drinkable despite a fair amount of hop bitterness.

Nice appealing hoppy aroma with a hazy golden appearance. Mild bitterness with fruity hoppy flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Almost clear golden pour with white head. Crisp aroma with lots of hoppy notes. Taste has malty base, balanced bitterness and comes together as a very nice beer.

Bottle poured an orange golden in color with a covering of white head. Aroma has bright hops, citrus blasted, sweet resins, and lager malts. Very clean and shows off all the hop goodness. Mouth feel is medium light and the carbonation a bit low. Flavor again has a great clean pilsner malt base, citrus, resins, a touch of sweetness, and finishes clean and crisp.

Bottle. Dark gold, big white head, hardcore lacing. Citrus tropical fruit aroma. The taste adds toast/biscuit malts and herbal yeast notes. The mouthfeel is lager all the way, crisp and clean. Wow! Perfect balance, best ipl Ive had! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark clear gold with a thick white head. Aroma is citrus and a little melon. Taste is heavy on the citrus with biscuity malt and lager yeast. Crisp mouthfeel and dry finish. Great balance and drinkability. Excellent.
Orange colour, white head. Aroma of hops, caramel, peaches. Taste is light sweet, light bitter. Light to medium body, slick texture, average carbonation. Very nice

This pours a burnished golden color out of the bottle with a sticky, foamy white head. Watery hop nose with some tropical fruit and cat urine notes. Light body with some crackers and lemon cookies and a strong pinching hop resin, tropical fruit and BO hoppiness to it. This is hop tea. If you like the new varietals of hops you will enjoy this beer.

Golden body, small head. Very hoppy aroma, mixing piney with herbal and grassy hops. Smooth refined malts, clean, almost too clean, but easily drinkable. Slightest bit too carbonated. Nice drinkable pilsner, holds very well. (33cl bottle from Bière Révolution)
Pours hazy brown-orange with a big white head. Nice aroma with strong hoppy notes also citrus and malt. Flavor is light to moderate sweet and bitter with nice citrus hoppy notes. Refreshing
Taster at, and bottle from, the brewery. Big hoppy nose. soft, oily body. Hoppy, biscuity malts, a bit sweet but crisp and flavorful with citrus and a bit of tropical. Nice drinking stuff.
Draft. Golden pour with white head. Light grassy, herbal hop aromas. Flavors are light herbal and grassy flavors, still isnt as good as a good ipa.

Bottle bought @ Ølbutikken. Pours hazy deep golden with a rather small frothy goldenish offwhite head that doesnt leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity, herbal and tiny malty with white bread, buttered crackers, grapefruit juice, canned tropical fruits in sugar syrup, freshly cut grass, pine needles, winegums, orange zest and lemon zest. Taste is slightly sweet, bitter and fruity with white bread, grapefruit juice, pineapple, overripe mango, passion fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, orange peal and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is crisp, round, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, bitter and fruity with white bread, grapefruit juice, overripe mango, freshly cut grass, pine needles, orange peal and lemon zest. Would have liked it drier
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Beaucoup de CO2, houblons bien présents dès lattaque en bouche. Bel équilibre, fraîcheur.

Bue en bouteille de 35.5cl, couleur blonde très grosse mousse effervescence moyenne une bière très houblonnée avec des arômes de fruit de la passion et dananas un peu trop de matières en bouche très malté...

Tap at prohibition pig; this keg is almost certainly past its prime, but there is no way to know. The appearance is tepid gold; the aroma is an amalgamation of tired, perfumed hop and alcohol with gritty, dog biscuit husk malt. The faded spruce and fresh tropical fruit notes are whimperingly present along with a sterilizing acetone flavor. Texturally slick with lots of trashy fruit peel notes mucking up the finish. There is no freshness or aliveness left here; this example surely has an extremely short shelf life.

12oz bottle. Clear deep bright golden with a small white head. Grassy grainy aroma with some citrus notes. Hoppy flavor, like an IPA (does it matter that its a lager really?). Pale malt and hop bitterness, grass and citrus. Clean and crisp, very drinkable. Good beer.
Clear orange colour with a white head. Really nice fresh herbal hoppy aroma with orange, apricot, mango. Very nice balanced flavour with grapefruit, pine, toast and caramel, with a dry bitter finish.
So hoppy, so tasty, bit spicy, great body... And very refreshing! Best Lager I ever drunk, and excellent even if you think of it as and IPA.
bottle description nails this beer perfectly..wicked good indeed..worth seeking out

Bottle->lager glass. Slightly hazy orange/gold with moderate white head. A: citrus hops, light bread, malt. T: zesty citrus hops, touch of bready malt underneath. Crisp finish. Lasting bitter aftertaste. Quite good.

On tap at birch hill tavern.. or the other 85 times Ive had this: Pours clear golden with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, slight flowers. Taste is super clean citrus, resin, a little floral, not at all sweet and not overly bitter. This beer is insanely good and is much better on tap than in a bottle. Medium body, medium carbonation, dry finish. Outstanding... one of my favorites.
Stunned, amazing! Dark golden pour with white head. Tropical fruit and citrus aroma. Crisp, lemon zesty citrusy. Hint if pine, a little bit citrus tartness. Plenty hoppy too. Absolutely delicious.

Draft at Cask Republic, New Haven. Definitely seeing a craze for this style lately, which makes sense. Combines the aromatics of a good IPA with the body of a lager. Pours a medium orange-amber, nose crisp and resinous, no heavy stickiness here. Body is smooth and maybe even a bit creamy, some graham cracker notes and lingering resinous bittering as well, glad to have given this a whirl, hopefully a Shelton Bros or some similar can get this going nationwide.

Bottle at Café Viking. Medium high white fluffy lasting head. Cloudy orange body. Sweet mango peach aroma. Dry fruity nutty flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long dry and bitter finish.

Bottle shared at Pauls. Poured a thin watery light clear gold with a small foamy white head. Aroma/flavor of earth, light dirty citrus, grassy hops. Medium to slightly lighter body, average carbonation and an average duration on the aftertaste.

Pours cloudy golden color with a decent sized white head. Nice citrus aroma with some tropical fruit. Sweet citrus start with some mango and pineapple notes. Finish is slightly metallic and pine holiness. Finish is smooth and crisp. This brew is wicked good!

Golden pour with some white head. Hoppy citrus nose and taste. Crisp lager finish. Nicely done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. This golden beer has a malty, almond, pine and orange marmalade flavour with smooth creamy notes on the bitter opine finish. Excellent!

12pz bottle thanks to BoostIPA. Damn, this is a lager? Badass. Pours pale gold, clear with rocky white head. Aroma of dank, skunky, hoppy goodness. Beneath that is just a little citrus. Taste: hop punch up front; fruity underpinnings. Remarkably clean and dry lager core beneath the hop front. Light body, lively carbonation. I could drink the shit out of this. This is fantastic.

This is a really nice beer - somehow the lagering mellows out the bitterness of the hops. Excellent mouth feel, excellent taste. As a New Englander, Im really glad to find a local IP(x) with a citrusy, not toasty, hopped flavor.
Fruity notes are moderate, a very well balanced beer with a dry finish versus the typical overpowering bitter aftertaste of an IPA.

Extraordinary beer, elegant but strong, extremely dry and tasty, perfectly rounded and finished after a development without a break. Its at the same level than, for instance, My Antonia. Great stuff.
I love this beer, my absolute favorite. Piney, citrusy smell. Bitter taste on the palate. I could live on this beer!
On tap at Ames Plow in Fanueil Hall, sweet aroma, resinous hops, sticky. Good beer.

Pours a yellow color with a white head. A floral aroma with a spicy scent. Taste is bitter with notes of coriander and heavy hops. The hops comes through cleanly with an overpowering punch. A good IPA flavor that was a little overdone.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2015 Many thanks to Rian for sharing! Bottled on 5th  March - so absolutely fresh! Fantastic floral fruity nose. Great floral fresh beer. Easy to drink, great hoppyness. Fresh floral hops. Grassy green brew, fresh, intense. Nice piney citrus, great intense fresh clean hoppyness. Round and great. A the hops are intense and in the foreground!

Bottle. Pours deep orange with a small, creamy, white head. Aroma has grass, sweet malts, light vinious. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has grass, citrus, malts, apple, fresh and quite elegant.
Taster at the brewery. Light golden yellow pour with a white head. Nice hoppy nose. Really nice clean hoppy flavor, spicy and a touch tropical. Never had a beer like this - very, very good.
Golden colour, Citrus bread aroma, Starts of slightly sweet, dry, and finishes bitter

Ive been drinking this beer for at least a year or two before Ive decided to review it. And its been one of my favorites since then. This beer has a very nice looking deep gold color with a finger width head. The body is super smooth. Taste and aroma are both wonderful. The aroma has a nice tint of that bready malt you find in good quality pilsners and pale lagers as well as an aroma of floral hops. The taste very nicely balanced with malt, citrus, and floral hops. At the same time its very easy drinking, clean, and delicious. Its a magnificent beer.

500ml bottle. Clear, orangey golden colour with average to huge, thick, frothy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Slightly grassy, hoppy aroma has manifold lemon notes, a touch of lime, hints of pine and pineapple. Taste is citrusy hoppy, minimally grassy, hints of pine and pineapple; soft palate, gentle though refreshing carbonation. More evidence for the fact that lager yeast and American/West Coast/dry- hopping go well together.
Bottle, 6.7% . Clear deep golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grapefruit, medium sweet, pine and nicely bitter.
Bottle from Liquors 44. Pours golden with a thin white head. Doesnt leave much lacing in the glass. Has a bit of a citrus thing on the nose. Has a few hop notes on the tongue. Finishes clean. Eh!
Bottle. Pours clear gold with white head. Nose and taste of hops, pine, lemon, toasted malt, grass and lager yeast. Clean. Crisp. Medium body.
Bottled. Pours cloudy gold. Hops citrus grapefruit and pine but a crisp lager finish. Good.

Tap at Century House as I showed up at end of wifes belated baby shower. Pours orange with nice juicy hop nose. Tastes of tropical fruit lychee and mango with some grapefruit and pine. Some spicy lager yeast and lively fun palate. Great beer

My first Jacks Abby offering. Very Tasty beer. Pours a clear gold with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, bread, toast, and mango. Taste follows the nose with a bit of orange in there as well. Mild bitterness up front and mainly dry on the finish. Body was medium and this was nicely carbed and fresh bottled within the last 30 days.
Courtesy of Lars. Golden coloured and almost clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Aroma is heavy hoppy, citrus and herbs. Flavor starts lightly sweet, finish heavy bitter. Dry texture.
Sweet hoppy aroma, ,amber, clear, whiet, light Sweet, medium bitter, medium, bitter, nice finish.

Appearance: Orange golden, slightly hay. Fizzy. OK amount of white head.
Aroma: Fruit and hops. Citrus.
Taste: Strong hops, citrus, fruit. Bitterness not too overpowering.
Info: 500ml bottle, 9/5-2014
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. hoppy mango citrus
Bottle @ home. Nice golden pour with a froth head. Light apricot and grain on the nose. Taste is apricot, some grape and sweet malts. Light bitterness to round it off.

Bottle outside Khioskh. Pale golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of tangerine, citrus, bread and mango. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of tangerine, mango, citrus and bread. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice and refreshing.
Bit like a strong hoppy lager. Has a nice bitter and grassy taste, but the body is a bit flat. Hops just work better in a top fermented beer.

A nice crisp, clean appearance combined with a hoppy aroma that isn't over powering like some hop forward beers can be. Unfortunately this offering has a very dry finish, in fact too dry for my tastes.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Bottle... Clear amber pour with a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. The aroma is musky and resiny with a slight facet of white pepper. Medium-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and busy carbonation. The flavor is both bready and heavily bitter. Finishes raspy, bitter and dry. Bottle courtesy of the always-generous biggsbowler!

At Zeebra Beer Festival, THX to everybody sharing todays beers.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, nice.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, oké.

Cobriza, con una capa de espuma blanquecina que termina por desaparecer.
Aroma floral del lúpulo sobre una base de malta.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass. There was no discernible freshness date. It cost $2.69 ($0.22 per ounce).

Appearance: A hazy, but bright shade of glowing peach flesh yellow/orange. No carbonation visible (which is odd considering its a lager). Pours to a large, white, frothy head which laces and retains very well.

Smell: Citrus and dank resin pine. Hints of garlic and other seasonings. 

Taste: Something Ive come to discover in 2013 is that theres a distinct "New England Style" IPA that smells and tastes of citrus or tropical fruit at first, but with a spicy vegetable flavor on the finish. Jacks Abbey Hoponius Union is very much in line with the style, though in this case the beer is actually a strong lager and not an ale. However, if that hadnt been indicated on the label, I doubt I (or most drinkers) would have made the distinction. 

The base palette here is pretty standard American IPA territory: citrusy hops up front that transition into something more dank and resiny at the peak and then finish with a slightly garlic or onion-like flavor. Many others of the regional style tend to be much stronger than this, though I actually appreciate the fact the intensity is a bit dialed-down here. Theres a slight sweetness riding along the entire time, imparting a honey or butterscotch-like flavor. The herbal component of the hops linger, creating for a slightly dry, slightly spicy sensation. Its not too intense or distracting, so it seems like an appropriate ending.

Drinkability: At 6.7% ABV and 65 IBUs, Jacks Abbey Hoponius Union is a perfect example of what an easy-drinking hoppy beer should be. Its flavorful and energetic in the mouth, but not so strong or obese that its a challenge to drink. The mouthfeel is surprisingly calm and smooth for a lager. Probably a great beer to pair with any dinner, though enjoying it on its own is quite satisfying.
