bottle from tom10101, thanks bro. pours unclear very light golden with a nice white head, good retention and lacing. spicy citrus and soft grapefruity resins, dankness or maybe a hint of phenols, peppery, herbal and floral notes, shy but present lager fruitiness - was hoping for more. average to moderate carbonation, bit of booze, medium body - oily, assertive spicy-herbal-grapefruity short to medium long finish. nicely done. good.

12 bottle pours hazy golden with a slight head. Very hoppy for the style, naturally. Hops are citrusy but a good amount of cat piss. Id be very surprised if simcoe hops were not used in this brew. Pleasant, dry finish. Its aight.

on tap at ABW while getting whales off the shelf. pours golden amber with an inviting head at covers the glass in lacing. nose of citrus and pine, mild grains. taste has same elememts but has solid bitterness upfront to pave the way for the adventure.excellent, body and very drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 Pours a clear golden with a thin white head that leaves great lacing. Aroma is grassy and lightly dank. Some citrusy hops in the background too. Taste is indeed hoppy and bitter (medium-high but never harsh) with some fresh cereals flavors buried in a pile of grapefruit rinds. No sweetness perceived so I would have to describe it as "dry". Body is light, texture a bit oily. Carbonation level is high, this is really drinkable. Nice!
Not blown away by an overally hoppy aroma this beer delivers in an easier drinking manner. Crisp and clean body with an orange yellow color. Could definitely throw back a few.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2013 Multiple draft samples at GABF 2013. Cleanly fermented with a vibrant tropical fruit, gum, sweet onion and resin-focused aroma / flavor. Medium to low apparent sweetness, medium bitterness, hugely hoppy / gummy / fruity flavor. Carbonation is froth and full while the malt is medium to light body. Clean and delicious, though Im not much a fan of these onion-y American hop strains in lager.

Bottle share by Ryan, hazy golden color with a quickly fading white head. Aroma of citrus hops and some grains. Taste is the same, taste is some citrus and light bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

October 6, 2013 - bottle via trade with Matt. Clear orangish pour with some head that faded quickly. Aroma was citrus / fruity hops with some grain. Taste was consistent with aroma, but also had some sweetness.
Aroma of citrius and pine. Slight bitter and hoppy taste. A very drinkable ipa i mean ipl. Very light crisp and smooth, good but i like a little more body and bite.

En fût. Verre de 6 oz dégusté chez Prohibition Pig (Waterbury, VT). Arôme: Légère odeur dagrume avec une pointe florale. Apparence: La couleur est dorée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune large dentelle le verre. Saveur: Léger goût dagrume et de céréale. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #5144)

I have found the perfect Ipa. Ok, technically this is an IPL (India Pale Lager). Crisp, clean and delicious! Jacks Abby never disappoints. From the Citra hop aroma, through the sharp, yet smooth finish, this beer is phenomenal. Eminently drinkable.

On tap at Blue Monk in Buffalo, NY. Light golden color, strong hop character, and extremely dry. Not overly citrus or piney, just a good solid bitterness throughout. Almost gave me a little pucker and I needed some water afterward. Good beer.

Bottle. Poured a clear amber color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate citrus hop, grain and fruit aroma. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Well worth having.

Bottle. My first beer while in Boston for training. Pours a pale gold with a thin head. Floral aroma with a nice citrus front and a light bitter finish. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 Tasted as draft and bottle. Hazy, light amber, yellow-tinged and lasting head, little lace. Hoppy nose, quite attractive.  Medium body, lean but smooth texture, right acidity and alcohol, feels more like an ale in the mouth than a lager, but not as rich. Intense hop flavor, good length. Bitter but not as much as a pils, balanced by some malt, dry. 5/6/15: Clear, medium gold, tall, lasting head. Medium body, well flavored, rounded texture, avg length, soft finish. Very malty, rich but lacking some sharpness or kick, honeyed background. Intense hoppy, herbal, resiny, malty flavor. Very tasty, nice example of the style. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice little beer. Pours orange without much head but great lacing. Malty and Hoppy with some booze and caramel. Light bitter finish with more booze. Average carbonation. On tap at prohibition pig.

500 ml. bottle. Thanks Vin! It pours a rich golden color with a nice thick white head. The aroma is intense with a nice blend of spicy onion and tropical fruity hops. Not much lager yeast, just smells like a West Coast IPA. The flavor is pretty much the same as the aroma with a dry, prickly mouthfeel that I guess suggests the lager aspect of this beer. Lots of onion and citrus. Really nice medium body. Pretty interesting beer. I wouldnt have guessed it was a lager. just a cool fermented West Coast IPA. Tasty stuff.

My Bottom Line :  
This crisp and floral India Pale Lager showcases quenching citrusy angles in a slender and truly satisfying body.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A sheet of foam sits atop the misty gold.
-If I could fault it for something, it is that malts could be a tad more expressive in the flavor profile. As is, they mostly support the engaging hop profile.
-This could not be more drinkable for a 6%+ brew.
-Sandy notes (cat litter to some) are intimated here and there.
-Wooden resins seal each sip.

Bottles.
Bottle courtesy Jay shared at Sante Adairius. Dusty resinous piney notes, pretty clean. This is a couple months old but you wouldnt know it.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2013 A hopped up lager? Wouldnt the time lagering takes degrade the hops? Happily not, this beer can roll with the hoppiest, freshest of IPAs. Not much to the appearance, only slightly more orange than an average lager. Great floral hop aroma, had a bottle a few weeks later that also had a lot of dank weed aroma. Very interesting flavors, quite spicy with bits of grass. Light and easy drinking, no real alcohol profile. Little aftertaste, just a hint of bitterness and some lingering flowers.

Bright golden pour, dense frothy white head. Aroma reminds me of a meadow: grass, flowers, and hay. Also grapefruit, hints of clementine, and bready malt. Bitter up front, rounded with a little sweetness. Smooth, a little more than light-bodied, and a moderate bitter finish.

500 ml bottle from WillRunForBeer. Pours a hazy light orange color with a big, thick, foamy head that fades slowly and leave nice lacing. Aroma is grassy and floral with some light citrus hops too. Taste is slightly sweet with a pretty strong bitterness. Very grassy and floral like the aroma. Fruity and bitter finish with a little pine. Medium body. Overall, pretty solid but Ive had many better Strong Lagers.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2013 Copper color and a stable head. Grassy and floral hop aroma. Wonderful Sweet hoppy aroma. Malt, hay, dough and wet grass flavors. A very rich body and a semi dry aftertaste. Incredible beer. One of the best on my trip.
On tap at Mad Taco. Pours golden with light head that dissipates quickly. Light citra hops aroma. Medium body. Very drinkable.
Pours amber with nice head, nice pine and floral and fruity hops, smooth and light bitter finish, all day drinker!
Hazy gold pour. Big hop aroma, grapefruit, pine, id guess ipa if i was blindfolded.. Honey sweetness up front, Pine, grapefruit, grass and beady malt. Very bitter, no alcohol detected. Medium body.
Bottle I shared at BCTC. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Big bright hops, soft citrus on the nose. Medium bodied, light grain, spicy citrus. Long citrus, grapefruit, pith. Tasty.

On tap @ Prohibition Pig. Pours a clear golden color with a finger of foamy white head. Aroma of citrus hops, pine, grass, and a malty sweetness. Taste is citrus and tropical fruits, a bit of pine, and some bready malts.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2013 Pours a pale golden with an off white head that recedes quickly. Very nice aroma of lemon peel and, to a lesser extent, pine. Starts easy with pale malt building to a citrusy hop finish and a bitter that follows the swallow, making you want another sip.
This has gotten smoother with about 3 months in the bottle. The bitterness at the end is still there, but not as sharp, citrus more forward. Upped my original 3.8 to a solid 4.

Bottle [500ml] c/o Glouglouburp. India Pale Lager eh? Interesting. Pours a hazy, bubbly golden-orange with a large lasting frothy off-white head. Some lacing on the glass. Really nice aroma is fruity and hoppy, with lots of citrus hops and tropical fruit along with beady malt and some herbal and floral notes. Flavours just as nice, lots of citrusy hops and plenty fruity, with citrus and tropical fruit and a long moderate bitter finish. Alcohol is hidden. Medium bodied. If all India Pale Lagers taste like this then bring them on cause this is awesome.

Bottle: The aroma consists of grapefruit, pine, and grass. It pours a golden-orange with a small white head that quickly fades to a thin film. The flavor starts with a quick dose of honey. The finish has moderate grapefruit, pine, and grass. Its light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

25 July 2013, bottle. Yellow, clear, no bubbles. Nose is straw and lemons. Thin/med body and mildly fizzy. Sugary malt, slightly lemon, lemon drizzle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gravity @ GBBF 2012, Great British Beer Festival, London Olympia, Hammersmith Road, London, England W14 8UX.Clear medium orange colour with a small to average, open and frothy - fizzy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, orange - citrus. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, citrus, hop bitter, dry, medicine notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20120809]

Draft at Pro Pig. Pours an orange gold with a billowy white head. Nose is big citrus with some faint malt. All about the hops. On tasting, earthy and citrusy, pithy grapefruit and moderate bitterness. Super clean. Good shit.

a - golden orange 1 finger head . S dank, soapy, resiny hops . Floral notes, sweet overripe citrus and feet. M med, low carb. Nice round ipa balanced, lingering sweet malty end. T tea bitters. citrus, dank hops, grassy, resiny. O good balanced ipa , slight malt leaning 3.4

From the 25 fl. oz. bottle mfg: 05-06-2013. The pour is a light amber color to bronze with an off-white head. Hops, herbs, and citrus are the leading esters on the nose. The body is light to medium. The taste has a dash more of the pale malts at first sip followed quickly by the moderate bitterness of a good IPA. Very nice.
Dry mouthfeel with some citrus and some herbs, floral citrus nose, decent brew.

Pour is transparent amber with a lot of fluffy white head and some large bubbles. Nose is light, clean and fresh. Some grain, a touch doughy, strong hop punch, tropical fruits light, grassy and herbal. Taste is the same, well attenuated, clean grain notes, a touch doughy, with a strong hop punch. More tropical fruit, grapefruit, grassy hop behind, and light bitterness with a dry well carbonated finish and lighter body.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange yellow. Thin white head dissipates quickly. Nice hop aroma. This is a tasty ipa that is drinkable but not too light. Not super complex but enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2013 Thanks eric

Smell of citra hops, lemon peel and orange

Taste was hoppy, sweet citrus and slightly bitter. Very smooth, with a nice crwmy head

Hazy amber/orange color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of nice floral hops, some yeast, grain/hay, & citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, floral hops, some caramel, and citrus; Finish is dry and slightly bitter; Very nicely balanced; Good stuff.

Where and how  Prohibition Pig 
Aroma strong high alpha hop feel. Blend of floral and citrus character. Clean golden malt as base.
 Appearance  
Top: medium white cap with light rings.
Base: clear dark gold.
Palate :  good approach with long finish. Wet hop feel. Medium bodied. 
Taste: plenty of raw hop character. As in aroma floral with citrus mix. Bitter. Golden clean malt base.
 Other notes  Think of Polish Mocne with top of high alpha hops. I love it.

Growler, Tap and Bottle.  Proof that lagers can stand with any IPA.  This pours a golden color with a white head.  Strong citrus and hop aroma, medium to light body.  Starts with malt and hops really take over, good/great tasting beer.

Pours a cldar golden color with a medium white head.  Aroma light herbal hops, some grass and sweet citrus.  Flavor has light sweetness followed by herbal and grassy notes.  Mouthfeel is full and and the finish is dry and citrusy/herbal/grass.,

Cask at Meadhall.  The beer pours to a golden body with a very thin white head.  The aroma and flavor is quite nice.  An interesting blend of tropical fruit, citrus, and a scosch of onion.  Vibrant hops.  Super easy drinking carbonation, likely due to the cask.

Bouteille de 500 ml, merci beaucoup à David. Arômes de houblons américains (zest dorange et résine). Très légères notes sulfureuses au nez. Robe dorée et limpide, effervescence moyenne et légère dentelle. En bouche, le houblon se montre plutôt aromatique, tirant surtout sur des notes dagrumes et de résine. Le caractère de fermentation demeure présent, avec de légères notes sulfureuses. Belle texture souple en bouche et finale relativement douce. Très facile à boire.

On tap at the Horse Shoe in Hudson. Asked the bartender which beer was the hoppiest. She was probably right. And despite the intensity of aroma and flavor light and smooth in body.. My first beer on my Boston trip and among the best (another being from this same brewery.) bitter but balanced by malt richness.

Pours amber/gold with decent lacing in the proper glass.Very nice hop aroma(slight sulfur). Malt flavor lasts about 1.5 second and then the hops take over in a big way. Satisfying bittersweet finish. Overall awesome brew. I absolutely can not go more than two days without a cold glass of just about any beer these guys make. These guys are masters of hopped up lagers!

Amazing idea to make a super-hopped lager. So points for that. But really, this beats most session IPAs hands-down for flavor and relatively low ABV. Wonderful beer and a steal at $2.69 for 1pt. 9oz. bottle in western MA.

16.9oz bottle, thanks to Mike L., shared. Code on bottle seems to read "MFG 04.19.2" ? Its a little cut off. Mostly hazy orange amber color. Thin white head, nice washes of lace. Nice piney citrusy kind of floral nose. Great bitter taste, a light zest. Just a light hint of that lager age. Medium body. Smooth, lighter carbonation, very easy drinking. Lightly creamy, almost. More dry finish. Awesome, crushable, intensely tasty india pale lager. Check it out.

1/2L bottle to taster (thanks DrSilvworm). Looks good; a transparent orange with white lacing. Smells solid; doughy and hoppy with a pleasantly skunky lager scent. Tastes like it smells, only better, with a Nice citrus presence and good mouthfeel. An awesome lager!

500ml bottle in a lager glass.  Pours golden with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of a lot of citrusy and floral hops, a decent amount of pale malts, and a little bread/dough.  Flavor the same with a good amount of hoppiness and a good texture for a lager.  A good, interesting beer.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours golden with medium white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruits, hoppy. Malt, sligth peppers, yeast. Taste is of citrus, tropical fruits, bitter finish. Palate: Ligth-medium body. Crisp. Overall: Very good, refreshing. Very nice yeast action.

Bottle (500 ml). Shared by Minderbinder, thanks! Clear orange with a medium white head and some lacing. Aroma is of fresh cereals, american hops and lot of citrus. Taste is also of fresh cereals along with citrus and peppery presence. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean, slightly dry. This is really a good beer. One of the most drinkable and refreshing Ive tried in a while. I would drink this everyday!

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2013 Pours a cloudy orange with a fair, white head.  Nose is lemon and floral, and I agree with other reviewers who have noted the grassy aspect to the scent.  Tastes of lemon and mildly of pine.  Theres an apparent malt backbone, but the sweetness is subtle and not at all cloying.  This is a refreshing, easy drinking beer that still has enough hops to please hop heads like me.  I really like it.
I cant believe how inexpensive this beer is for the topmost quality !   Wonderful hops with a finish that tapers off to expose its lager roots in an unobtrusive, clean manner.
Poured from a bottle thanks to lukaduke. Pours a hazy light yellow with a nice white head. Aroma is floral and citrusy. A lot of hoppy, citrusy bitterness. This beer is awesome!

Bottle thanks to Matt. Thanks for the hookup!  Aroma of great apricot, reisling, grass and slight lemon.  Pours amber with a medium foamy head.  Taste is  nice and hoppy with good citrus zest, grass and slight simcoe cat piss.  Great malty lager finish.  Very enjoyable!

Ahh... Lager. HUGE thanks to Edmund Edmonds for this bottle!  Youre awesome, bro!  Pours a clear gold with a puffy white head. Nice aromas of citrus with some pine in there as well. Really fruity and clean. So clean. Very light malts, with a long, dry finish. Excellent.

Slightly hoppy, grassy smell. Pours burnt orange and very clear. White head that disappeared. Low-medium carbonation which I really enjoy. Easy drinker. Clean hoppy taste that doesnt over power and has just enough body to let the hops stand out cleanly. Nice IPL.

Bottle at home, acquired through trade - super pumped I finally got a chance to try this one. Pour is crystal clear orange with a huge white head and great lacing. Hoppy, citrusy, grassy aroma, with lighter notes of biscuit, straw, and dough. Taste is super clean, yet hoppy - grassy, sweet grapefruits, orange peel - biscuity, lightly malty, a touch of caramel sweetness and a hint of bitterness on the backend. Medium mouthfeeel with high carbonation. Nice pils.

Bottle from trevdawg...thanks Evan! - So I love pilsener but dont really care for imperial pilsener. Hmm...here goes! Pours with a huge foamy head atop a clear light amber body. Big herbal and fruity hops on the nose, a bit of pine, and some dank garlic hops. Love the variety here. Sweet boozy malt underneath ruins things a bit for me. Same taste, though the finish is pretty sharp and boozy. Slick and thin-bodied. This was decent, but Ive said it before and Ill say it again--why imperialize pilsener?

Bottles received today from Allen! Thanks! Pours a clear golden color with a fingers worth of white head. Its so translucent, I can watch the Blackhawks game on the TV through it. Nose is a balance of sticky, resinous hops and lager yeast. The taste starts out toasty and crisp and finishes with a healthy dose of bitter pine. Mouthfeel is light and crisp with only a light lingering bitterness. It is incredibly drinkable and very balanced. Probably my favorite offering from Jacks Abby so far of the 8 or 9 Ive had. The gold standard for hoppy lagers as far as Im concerned.
Very solid beer, hoppy as heck, lots of citrus, very clean tasting.  I have gotta say I am impressed w. the local beer from MA.

Pours a clear, light golden color with an impressive white head. Speaking of impressive, the nose on this lager is a big surprise. Grapefruit and pine a plenty. A nice medium-bodied mouthfeel that has adequate carbonation and dryness at the finish paves the way for grapefruit, pine, and floral flavors make this extremely drinkable lager very tasty.

Clear orange pour with a nice creamy off-white head.  Aroma is bursting with citrus, and to a lesser extent, piney hops.  Nice body, crisp and light mouthfeel but with a solid, sweet malty backbone.  Resinous, oily and strong hop flavors, mostly citrus *orange*grapefruit.  Lingering sweetness and piney hops, finish is just a bit too bitter.  This is the best IPA I have had in a while. Fantastic.
Citrus, flower, and pine in a somewhat mild aroma.  Taste is clean and starts a little sweet with some citrus, and a nice bitter punch in the finish.  Another solid effort from a good local brewery.

500ml bottle. Pours light orange with a fluffy white head that dissipates quickly.  Barely anything on the nose, hint of citrus. Clean and a bit sweet up front with a nice bitter finish. Very interesting for a lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 Fresh, floral hops join with a mildly sweet malt base, yielding deliciousness in my mouth. Smooth as can be, like the best single IPAs Ive tasted. Not sure how much of this is attributable to the lager yeast; all I know is that this is pretty damn good.

Single 475 mL bottle purchased for exactly $3 (!!!) at The Wine Bottega, on Hanover in Boston. To stemmed glass it pours an astonishingly amber with a bubbling body, and a foamy off-white head,  2½. fingers in length. Smells zesty; its of grapefruit juice, clementines, Bible paper, citron melon seeds,farmed hay, mentha, yeast, and hops. Rad!  Tastes of lager yeasts, noble hops, a little grapefruit, wine lees, heather, chamomile. Ends earthy and bitter. Oh, yes: I liked this.

12 oz. bottle served in a Southern Tier tulip. Thanks to eorwar for the share.

A: Pours a clear golden yellow color with a fluffy white head forming on the pour. It recedes slowly to thin ring. Some splotchy lace is left down the glass.

S: Lager yeast profile with a light hoppiness to it. Subtle pale malts in the periphery.

T: Has a nice hoppy greenness to it with a mild citrus backing. Lager yeast profile with some sweet pale malts, but a nice hoppy bitterness cuts in at the end.

M: Very light bodied with a medium high carbonation level. Super easy drinking. Lightly bitter finish.

O: This was solid, but it was definitely hyped up in my head as being the best lager in the world. While it was very easy drinking and I would have again, I wouldnt put it in the upper echelon.

Serving type: bottle

IPL, this beer wont get rted highly because the asinine pretentious beer-rating culture has deemed lagers to be unimpressive, but this beer is better than 95% of IPAs being produced in the world right now.  In a blind tasting, none of the obnoxious beer-nerd assholes would be able to tell this was a lager.

In short: A bright and clean citrusy American IPA (except this one is a lager).
How: Bottle 500ml.  Consumed fresh a few weeks after purchase from the brewery, bottle given to me by lushawn, thanks a lot Shawn.
The look: Mostly clear pale golden body topped by a medium white head.
In long: Nose is fresh, clean and bight citusy hops.  Taste has clean fresh cereals, a whole lot of citusy hops, notes of pine needles, some citric notes.  Very clean bitterness of medium-high intensity.  There is something I really about how citrusy hops come out in a lager (both in the aroma and taste), it comes out cleaner, with more definition.  It is truly incredible that we can mimic the taste of citrus fruits so well in a beer without using citrus fruits at all, so now can someone please make a healthy salad that taste like a delicious greasy pizza?
Hoppy aroma, some fruits. A bit one dimensional aroma. Smooth mouthfeel with a bitter finish. Good lager

Thanks to Fromson for this bottle! 500 mL. Slightly hazy orange gold pour. Nose and flavor bring big nectar fruit and mango and awesome tangerine citric sweetness but moves to dry pils character. Seemed almost like Galaxy hops in there, or Prima on steroids. Awesome.

Thanks, Mike, for sending me this! Poured into a snifter. Nose is big pine tree and citrus rind/grapefruit. Some light, but clean grain notes play second fiddle to the hops. Taste is pretty similar with a more pronounced grain/biscuit flavor behind the massive hop infusion. Now this is my kind of lager.

Thank you, OmegaX, for bringing this flavor lager to our tasting. The pour was a very nice yellow with a bone-white head. Aromas were of fresh hops; piney, citrus-filled and with light grassy notes among honey undertones. The flavor was malty and fruity with plenty of hop profile. If it wasnt so sweet and smooth, I would have though this was an IPA. IPLs are becoming a favorite here.

Bottle thanks to Alex! Pours a clear gold with a white head that lasts throughout the beer and laces beautifully. Aroma has a great combination of bitter citrus and light pine with just a touch of grain backing. Flavor starts with pine and bitter citrus and has a biscuit note that grows through the finish.

Bottle from Julios. Pours a clear gold with a 2 finger white head. Aroma is loaded with floral and citrus scents. Flavor is hop forward with a grapefruit/pine taste up front. Just right, not a hop "bomb" at all. Malty undertones. Clean, dry finish. Light bodied.
Sampled at Rories house.  Almost clear with a small off white head.  Nice hops in the aroma and in the flavor.  Bitter citrus and oniony.  Good but not great.

Arôme de houblons frais mais avec lastringence subtil de la levure lager. En bouche, cest douloureusement croustillant avec un raz-de-marrée dagrumes très mures et de résine de pin. La finition est modérément sèche avec une amertume plaisante et tenace.

Pours a slightly foggy gold, with a few fingers of fluffy white head. Smells richly of citrus-y American hops, with notes of lemon, and fresh pine-wood. Taste starts with crisp hops and barley, and quickly springs a bittersweet citrus medley of bitter lemon rind, and sweet limeade. Finishes slightly on the dry side, with a slight dynamic of sweetness and bitterness. Mouthfeel hits every part of the tongue but the back. Its on the full side, but not aggressively carbonated. This is the first "Imperial Pils" Ive tried, and Im intrigued by its ability to retain such a crisp and floral taste of a double IPA, but without the heat and strength.

Bright golden
2 finger creamy solid white head 
Lovely nose of pine and tangerine skins. Zesty and full of simcoe and maybe warrior hops. 

Taste is piney, slightly sweet. Honey and grapefruits at the finish

On Tap at the Alehouse
Pours a hazy golden with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is earthy, grassy hops with a light crackery maltiness.  Creamy and quenching, the flavor is a nice balance of sweet grapefruit, pine hop bitterness and a smacking lager base.  Quaffable and Tasty.

Thanks to GatorGuy92 for sharing this one.  Cheers, Matt!  Pours a hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is light malt, earthy hops, and a bit of lager in the back.  Flavor follows with a bit of malt, some light grassy and herbal hops, and lager in the finish.  Interesting take and lingering hops and lager on the finish.

Bottle @ home via trade with Ernesto987. Thanks! Pours a hazy dark golden appearance with a bubbly/spider web, off white head. So,ewhat piney, a bit resiny, light citrusy, fresh hoppy, a bit chewy yeasty, toasty malty aroma. Big rich grapefruit citrusy, chewy yeasty, a bit bready, cracker, grassy flavor. Kick ass session brew that is kind of fun to chug. Id probably reclassify this as a Zwickel in style.

Bottle gn0sis. Pours gold with a nice, slight but persistent white head. Aroma is pine and citrus. Taste is very well balanced. Sweet, resiny, lightly bitter. Nothing overpowering. Very drinkable, which Im realizing is a dangerous trend with these Jacks Abby beers.

50cl bottle pours a clear gold with some cloudy, white head.  Nose is inviting, American hops, citrus, honey.  Flavor is spicy, a little pepper, apple skin, slightly sweet, grassy.  Dry, clean finish thats only lightly bitter.

transparent gold, puffy white head, large bubbled. Nose is lightly metallic, grassy, sweet dough and light pine. Flavor sweeter than expected, dough and grass, oily, lightly bitter but soft like tipopils, lacks grain depth.

500mL thanks to dfroms! Pours a clear, bright golden, smaller white foam. Nose is cantaloupe, cheese, dust, body odor, starfruit. Taste is nutty, cantaloupe, dusty, starfruit, nutty bitterness. Palate is oily, dense, some sugar. Easy to drink though not super fresh tasting. Please bottle date!!!!

Lightly hazy pale yellow pour with a thin white head. Nice strong aroma if American hops.  Lots of pine peach and tangerine. Flavor us sweet peppery and crackery. Very bitter hoppy finish with floral tangerine notes. Bitterness lingers on the tongue.
Pours like a cannon out of the pint+, glorious head and constant, thorough lacing.  As advertised, it uniquely unionizes west coast hops with an alternative lager twist.  The IPL is born justly.

.5 liter from Bootya. IPL? Sure, why not? Tasty, and aggressively hoppy but light in body with a faint bit of fruit on the palate. Leaves a little bit of gumminess when all is said it done but this beer is great.

Poured into lager glass.

Deep golden orange with a humongous frothy head that subsided to a tight layer with tons of lacing start to finish. Aroma was malty, earthy, some yeast, citrus fruit, a slight but of pine resin. The citrus aroma reminds me of lemon lime hard candies. Get the malts immediately on he sip, then a huge blast of citrus more grapefruit than the nose suggested. Earthy underneath, nice hit of bitterness, not overwhelming. Tiny bit of breadiness or yeast, slightly toasty. Flavor hits and passes quickly, and grapefruit and maybe mango linger just a bit. Very clean and refreshing, light on the palate. Finishes dry and makes you want more. The carbonation is light and refreshing. Very drinkable and can see this on a hot summer day.

Bottle - nice yellow pour that is slightly cloudy and carbonated and also good head retention. There is an intense sweet aroma on this one as in maybe a sweet orange. The body is medium and has a grassy finish.

50cl bottle.  Large off-white head atop clear light amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, catty, some orange.  Taste is moderately sweet, catty, grapefruit, some pine, light orange.  Fairly clean medium body, light resin, acidity.

500 ml bottle shared by Kan. Thanks! Pours a nice amber gold hue, a touch of darkness, firm haze and good frothy head atop sticks around well. Aromas are a bit sticky, toasty, and dry. Earthy florals, good citrus and earth. Firm hops, a touch toasty. Initial is lighter end of the fold, some toast, firm dryness. Bready malts, earthy florals, touch of tropical fruit, lemons and orange. Middle is a bit sweet and dull, firm dryness and a good hop kick. Earthy, some dryness, bready malts and some gentle toast elements. Backend is dry more tropical fruit and grapefruit come forward. Some gumball, kiss of mango. Finish is a good dryness, firmly bitter but not overwhelming still giving some odes to the malt base and fruity hops. Pretty solid

Bottle thanks to ILOVESTOUTS, poured into a Hill Farmstead glass.

Pour: Nearly clear orange with two fingers of white, super sticky head. Leaves incredible lacing, and the head forms a nice film. 

Smell: A definite lager aroma hits at first, but then is crushed by a huge pine and citrus profile. Big lemon and limes. Some light breadyiness tries to balance, but only barely. 

Taste: Again, lager bready hits first, but the hops hijack the taste in an instant. Huge pine, and some clean citrus. A little bit of doughy breadyness it, but only just. Finishes bitter with pine.

Mouthfeel: Its a lager, so naturally, this is amazingly drinkable. The hop profile reminds me of Sculpin. Nice bitterness, and very refreshing.

Overall: This is a beer I would choose over most IPAs. Just fantastic.

Hazy orange, nice white head. Aroma is fresh cut hay and grapefruit. Full bodied and hoppy. Lots of citrusy hops, and some grassy hops, as well. Some faint, toasty malt flavors. Not a lot of lager character, but Im cool with that. Thanks, Secret Santa!
Pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma has citrus, leather, peach. Flavors are very clean, citrusy, grapefruit, resin. Really good soft ipa like beer.

500ml bottle much again thanks to the lu for sending these our way... pours a lightly hazy apricot orangey consistent, somewhat transparent, and topped with a thin film of creamy white head... fresh and juicy dank citrus and melon fruitiness throughout.  pretty tasty with a sweeter middle but fruity... flavors are the same with a juicy citrusy hop forwardness, an earthy aspirin malt quality through the middle which adds a semi-sweetness.  medium bodied, refreshing, with just the right amount of carbonation.  nice hop assertiveness in these lagers which i really dig.  pretty darn diggable.
Very hoppy citrus aromas. Hoppy citrus flavors with a little earthy malt backing. Overall a very very good hoppy lager.  Thanks Gabe!

Growler shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike.

The beer is clear and golden hued with a small head that leaves sparse lacing on the tulip. Lots of fresh hop character in both the nose and taste. This drinks much more like an IPA than a German lager. And while this beer is tasty, it does lack the distinctive characteristics of a Dortmunder lager. The body is light and the finish is dry, offering a hint of lager yeast. Overall, a tasty brew. Easy to drink and flavorful, just dont expect an authentic example of the style. I would definitely have this again.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 02-12-2012

Growler compliments of Frank with Bill, Allen, James, and Dallas. Pours a glowing hazy golden orange with thin head and pretty nice lacing. Aromas and taste of cheese, pine, citrus, and other funky fruits. Medium bodied refreshing lager. Real crisp and clean hoppy finish. Awesome.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle. My his what a wonderful aroma. Citrusy, floral, grassy, the nose is all hops. The flavor is filled with hoppy goodness, a little vegetal, some soft malt character. A very easy drinking, hoppy lager.

500ml bottle into a SA perfect pint. Just showed up on shelves again so fairly fresh.

A - Pours a very clear golden amber body. Massive amount of sudsy foam. Clinging and sticky with excellent retention.

S - Piney and bitter grapefruit, floral grass, and cereal grain. Very IPA like, subdued but excellent.

T - Bitter hops. Citrus, pine, grass, and some lemon. Then comes a cleaning wave of grainy malts. Quick finish with just a light lingering bitterness. Drinkability is incredibly high on this beer. Crisp and well carbonated.

O - Jackss Abby knows lagers and this is the best one Ive tried from them yet. Takes the best elements of an Indian pale ale and a pale lager to create an incredibly delicious and sessionable beer.

Bottle, approx 3 months old. Not the freshest this beer has been, but it was still in very good shape. Clear gold pour with white head, nice hoppy aroma, slightly earthy hops, lots of grapefruit, pepper. Taste is hoppy, light bready malt, slightly earthy finish. Good stuff.

Enjoyable beer. Great balance between hops, malts, sweetness and bitterness. Grassy hop explosion on the aroma...fresh and sweet, love the aroma. Taste is just as good. Hoppy grass up front with a sweet bitter finish. White lacing left on glass...yellow/orange cloudy color. Big fan of this beer. Next time I am in Mass. I will seek out.
Beatifuly citrus and floral notes up front, with a fantastic malty, sweet finish.  Great time.

9th August 2012GBBF. Light haze on this amber beer. Few white bubbles for a head. Light dry palate. Fine carbonation. Good grassy - minty hops with green hops sting and nice tangerine - orange citrus underneath. Grassy finish which is dry and crisp. Another very good and fresh cask IPA from the US - salute BSF!

Medium orange body, one inch white head, soapy lacing.  Nose is mild citrus -- grapefruit, pineapple, orange.  Light grassy notes round out the profile.  Flavor is a bit muted as pale, lightly bready malts start to assert themselves.  Medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation, light, refreshing bitterness and a clean finish.

Pour from a bottle gave a cloudy golden color with a moderate white head. Aromas of citrus and some yeast. Really great fresh lemon, pineapple, and grapefruit flavors. Hard to tell this is an IPL. Very easy to drink but without being too thin in body. Could make this a regular if I had access. Really liked it!

bottle, from wifes coworker. Good aroma, sweet, citrusy, orange. Toasted malt, kind of almond like. little grassy, little peppery. Clean orange gold color, good head that faded quick. spotty lace, Bitter sweet flavor. medium body, creamy oily smooth body, bitter finish. Darn nice. Real smooth for something that has a nice bite about it. very drinkable, aroma and flavor equally enjoyable. good stuff from my old stompin grounds...
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
Aha! The TSA only smashed one of my bottles... Had this on tap at Lord Hobo in Boston and decided to bring some home.

Pours a nice hazy yellow with a bright thick head. Sweet citrusy aroma, fresh grass clippings, and a bit of tropical fruit.

Light bodied, crisp carbonation. Wonderful grassy, citrusy taste, hoppy bitter finish. So fresh, so clean. A bit of yeastyness.

A truly amazing lager.. Dances around on the tongue like a fresh west coast apa.. I remember a bit more fruity character on draft but it holds up really well in the bottle. (bottled aug 28, 2012)

Combines the aromas of pine and grapefruit with the lightness of a pils. Its hazy orange like many stronger lagers. Perhaps only 65 BUs, but impossibly bitter for its crisp, light body. There are other hoppy lagers from various US brewers, but they always feel cheap. This one does not.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2013 Jacks Abbey does it again.  They take a lager and transform it into something amazing.  It looked and tasted like an IPA.  Golden/orange hue with that sticky head.  Big citrus hoppy nose.  Fantastic.  

*Even better the 2nd time!

Pours a nice clear golden color with a fluffy three finger white head... aromas are tropical fruit, floral, citrusy hop forward bomb. Smells ripe !  On the palate  its full of the same... big flavors of pineapple citrus a touch of grapefruit and a bit of malt sweetness on the back of the mid-palate that all gets tweaked up a few notches by a creeping bitterness that overtakes the finish but remains clean and refreshing with no sign of stickiness. Great fresh IPA that puts a lot of other local New England IPAs to shame..especially considering the price tag !
Bottle. Hazy golden color, massive white head, good retention. Aroma of fresh flowers and grass. Taste is bitter fruit and grass.

Aroma is fruity, floral, wooden, sugary, sweet malty along with some nectary notes. Flavour is fruity, floral, grassy and earthy. Not as aggressive in the flavour as the aroma was.
500ml bottle.  Hoppy, piney, a little bit  of citrus.  Unlike any lager ive had.  A pretty good extra hoppy pale ale imo.

Bottle. Pouts a golden orange color with a big white foamy head. Nose is fresh citrus and grass. Palate is crisp with a light bite. Flavors of grass and toasty malt notes with a nice balancing of fresh hop notes that are dry and crisp. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drinkable, hoppy, and interesting.  This is what a hopped lager should taste like.  Not syrupy and with good carbonation.  Extremely well-made.

Cask at Great British Beer Festival 2012, Olympia, London. A golden coloured pour with a medium off white head on top. Hoppy, citrus, pine aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, refreshing and tasty.

Golden in color with a white head.  A very nice citrus hop aroma and plenty of floral notes to go with it.  There are some pine notes to it as well as a light grass note.  Very little in terms of malt.  The palate is on the dry side with a lot of hop flavor to it.  Citrus fruit and peel, lots of floral notes, pine, and a hint of grass.  Just a bit of biscuit and cracker malt flavor.  Very well done.

500mL bottle, split several ways, pours a clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is full of piney hops, some resin and lots of grainy malts - very inviting nose. Flavour of grainy malt, lager yeast and very pungent piney hops. Long lingering hoppy finish, though in a clearly lager way. Very well-made and highly drinkable.

Tap at Meadhall during their Anniversary party. Light golden pour with a white head. Hoppy aroma like any strong pale ale or IPA. Mostly citrus and juniper berry. Taste is light bodied with a floral flavor up front and juniper oil on the end. Bready malt finish. A good hoppy lager but I like my IPAs a little more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Crisp and refreshing in a way than an ale could never be, this India pale lager is in a league of its own. Plenty of bright and citrusy hops lend to a great aroma and taste, while the cleanliness of the lager lets each note shone through without any murkiness. Jack's Abby is killing it!

Comrock12

"...and the rest of the day to you!"
Rated with Beer Buddy

Bottle from Muckys. A medium clear golden brew. Frothy white head that goes to lacing. Good carbonation. Light spicy and citrus aromas. Flavor includes lightly sweet honey notes with plenty of citrus spice. Some grapefruit. Very clean and crisp finish. Lingering bitterness but very refreshing. Very interesting. Cant believe nobodys thought of this before. IPL!

(Draft @ Amesbury Alehouse) Served in a shaker. Aroma of fruity hops and caramel. Taste mirrors the aroma with a slightly rough mouthfeel and a touch of stickiness on the back end. Drawn-out, bitter finish. Just enough booziness to keep it interesting.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2012 bottle.   bright, clean, crisp  fresh cut grass and pine hops with an extra dose of tangerine and grapefruit hoppiness.   quite hop forward, but not overly abrasive.   very  dry.    tasty, refreshing, awesome. cant. stop. drinking.    like quite a bit.   not terribly complex, but lovin the crisp dry grass and grapefruit hops lagerbeer.

16.9oz bottle into a pilsner glass, this is nice!  Aroma of organic hops, fresh grain, mighty citrus meandering over the fence, and solid orange peel additives.  Color is bright and strong dark orange with fire streaks and slight amber.  Taste is just hoppy and citrus all over the place.  So fresh going down, this is excellent.  Im thinking ipa all the way, but the label says otherwise.  I dont know about that....  But, this is a wonderful and vivid example of a splendin microbrew.  Whether a hybrid or not, find this one.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2013 Pours crystal clear orange. Nose is bright citrus, and pleasant mild tropical fruit some sweet malts and floral and slight grassy hops. Flavor is ultra clean with a nice blend of light orange, grapefruit and mangos, a touch of peaches, spice, and some resinous dankness-almost a sweet orange juice character in there as well. Smooth mouthfeel and caramel malts are easy and light. Really nice beer! Cant really tell its a lager but whatever. Stands up well against the rest of the great IPAs. Thanks to Alec

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2012 Draft with Linh and Scarlett at picco in Boston. Pours a light orange body with carbonated, white head. Aroma is grassy and bitter citrus. Mouthfeel is crisp and refreshing with notes of grass hops, bitter citrus, light floral flavors and a zesty earthiness. RERATE:::: Growler at Franks with Dallas, Vinny, Alan, Bill and Frank. Pours a light orange body with nice haze and white head and lots of lacing. Aroma is fresh citrus, freshly cut grass, light pine and a light lager grain. Mouthfeel is super fresh and earthy. Awesome + 0.4.

Thanks to J for bringing this treat. Smells of citrusy hops, some resin, light sweet malt backbone. Initially lightly sweet, then some the hop flavors appear after that appears a light bitterness that is dry and delicate. This beer is wonderfully carbonated and smooth. This is a very well make beer - hopefully I will get a chance to try more of their beers on trips back to the US.

Bottle.  This is a unique beer and remarkably hoppy.  Looks pretty standard and the palate feels fresh (this was bottled within the last week or three).  But the aroma is a huge Northwest hop bomb of resin, very ripe tropical fruit, and catty funk.  Love it.  The flavor is sticky sweet and alpha acid and hop bitterness.  In the middle and end the lager character comes out as the body thins and turns sticky.

Pours a light clear yellow with minimal head. Smells really hoppy, pine, grapefruit and citrus, taste has a very balanced hop profile with a very good clean finish, lager yeast gives it a bready flavor. Really interesting and pretty good.

Pours gold into a Sam glass. White head with medium retention recedes to hug rim. Sweet cookie dough, caramel, weed and citrus aromas. Medium balanced with sweet caramel upfront turning to mild resin before the lasting grapefruit finish.

Draft. Served in a tulip, great lace, sheets down the side of the glass. Light Co2. Nose is tons of fruit.  Taste is mostly clementine oranges. Citrus, spicy hops dominate the palate, malt plays second fiddle. Gets significantly more bitter as it warms. Lingering spicy hops. Cool concept in a cold fermented IPA

On tap at Battleship.  Pours a clear golden color with a thick bubbly head.  Aroma is of fresh hops, weeds, and grain.  Flavor is similar. Hops, orange, and lime really take charge here.  Very clean and crisp beer.
GLBN IPA Challenge 2012, liher straw colored pour. Citrusy IPA?? Impy Pils? Grapefruit pith. Good flavor, solid beer

Huge thanks to Reagan1984 for getting this growler out my way. Served in a mug since Ive packed all my lager glassware pre-move.

Pours a clear light golden color with a nice white head and some spotty lacing as it goes down. Thin collar throughout. The nose brings some nice tropical fruits with a bit of citrus and resin there as well. The flavor profile is along the same line and is really fantastic. Beautiful fruits and a nice hoppiness throughout. Moderate bitterness throughout and a dry finish. Body is fairly light. Finish is fantastic. This is a very, very impressive beer.

This was the first JA beer I tried a few months ago, and it was love at first sip.  Its a unique combination of a crisp lager with a huge grassy hop profile that competes with the best IPAs.  I have been impressed with other JA beers since, but this is the flagship that will distinguish them as they broaden the distribution.

growler... dark gold, a bit of copper, nice color, off white head, good retention... smells like a hopped lager, reminds me of humulus lager, tastes like it as well, super easy to drink very flavorful... excellent lager

Pours a clear light copper color, decent foamy head.  Hop nose shows plenty of hop character, though nothing really new or unique.  Plenty of citrus and resinous notes.  Flavor follows- solid hop profile showing lots of citrus and pine notes.  Mild bitterness throughout.  Body has enough weight to carry the hops without lending too much sweetness.  Very good beer, an entirely worthwhile east-cost hoppy brew.

Fantastically tasty IPL(India pale lager).  A huge citrus bomb which tasted very fresh and delightful on tap at a hipster bar.  Grapefruit, orange, grass, and a unique quality that made it interesting which is probably the result of the lager yeast.

A golden Imperial Pils with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet butterscotch with light vanilla notes. In mouth, a smooth grassy hops with green apple skin, grainy malt, alcohol warmth, smooth and interesting. On tap at Sunset Grill, Sept. 11 2011.
Very citrusy aroma, clean super hoppy flavors. Very fun fresh beer, very hoppy flavors and without much bitterness. Delisious

Every once in a while you pick a beer of a list with no idea what to expect.  This was one of those times and boy did it pay off well.  Even my IPA-averse girlfriend thought this was great.  Pours a clear gold with soft pillowy head.  Huge hop aromas - citrus, tropical fruits, apricot, resin running the show.  Stiff malt backbone.  Beautifully balanced, crisp, drinkable.  Enjoy how it evolves as it slowly warms up.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2011 On draft at brewery. This is my favorite of all the Jack brews. Very similar to an IPA in aroma and taste but actually a lager. Huge hop aroma up front with an excellent hop taste throughout. Got me a growler to go for further study.

Pours pale golden and clear.  Wonderful aroma of resin, floral, and citrus as good as any double IPA.  Well balanced and delicious, the hops flavor is front and center without overpowering biterness.  This is a great beer that is my favorite from this brewer.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2012 On tap.  Pale yellow in color.  Has a hint of hop/citrus aroma.  This beer has a nice balance of maltiness, bitterness and aroma hops.  The citrus hop flavor is fairly prominent relative to typical IPAs, which I like very much.  The light carbonation made this smooth and easy to drink.  Very good, overall.

Update for a bottled version I just tried- the hop aroma was much stronger and fantastic.  Maybe it was fresher than the tap version I last sampled.  +2 points on aroma.

On tap at the brewery. Dense and intense aroma of fresh crushed citrus, gooey pine resin, and florals all melded together beautifully. The flavors are just as sharp and alive. This is so, so, so, so much better than 90% of all hoppy beers on the market and embarrasses most IPAs in terms of hop flavor and textural balance. Crisp, pungent, and lively. The flavors marry so well, into that explosive, rich emergent hop flavor that Im always looking for in good Double IPAs. I thought it was so good, we left the tasting room and went out to find a bar that had it to get a full pour. Exceptional hop brewing!
